title: Stardew Valley 1.7 Update Will Feature New Farm Type And "Lots More"
description: Eric "ConcernedApe" Barone has teased what's coming with the 1.7 update for Stardew Valley, such as a new farm type, more social stuff, and "lots more." In addition, the game's creator says we'll get an update about the Switch 2 Edition sooner than later. On X, Barone responded to a fan asking about any hints for the Stardew Valley 1.7 update. "There will be some more character/social stuff; it's also traditional to add a new farm type," Barone replied. "Lots more, but I don't want to reveal much yet." The upcoming update for the farming/life sim was revealed in August, with Barone noting in September that it's going to take "a while." there will be some more character/social stuff, it's also traditional to add a new farm type. Lots more but I don't want to reveal much yet — ConcernedApe (@ConcernedApe) December 17, 2025 Before then, Stardew Valley is planned to get a Switch 2 Edition that will include mouse controls and four-player local co-op. The update will bring GameShare functionality to the title, too, and was scheduled to roll out this fall. For those keeping track, there are only three days left in the fall season (in the Northern Hemisphere), but Barone said on X that he'll "announce something very soon" for the Switch 2 version. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Fallout TV Show Has No Todd Howard Cameos, And Here's Why
description: Bethesda's Todd Howard is the steward of the company's popular Fallout franchise, and many might have reasonably assumed he would have a cameo in the Prime Video TV show. He did not in Season 1 and does not have one in Season 2, either. But why? Howard told IGN that he has been offered "a whole bunch" of cameo opportunities for the Fallout show, one of which was a doctor role at Vault-Tec. But Howard declined that opportunity and all others. "I think I'm best behind the camera," he said. Howard went on to say he's rejected all cameo pitches because he does not want to draw focus away from the storytelling, even if it would only be for a small moment. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Global vehicle market remains strong in November
Vampire Survivors Meets The Viking Age In This Week's Epic Games Store Freebie
description: The Epic Games Store continues to give away a free game each week, and this week is another nice find with a price that can't be beaten. Every Thursday at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET, Epic offers at least one free PC game (and sometimes even as many as two or three). All you need to do to claim the free games is create a free Epic account and enable two-factor authentication. You have a week to add the freebies to your library before the new one(s) take their place. At this point, Epic has given away hundreds of free games, and there's no sign that the program will stop any time soon. The company has also extended its freebies to Android devices, and you can claim a free game every week here as well. We keep this article up to date weekly to highlight both the current free games and next week's offerings. If you're looking for more freebies, you can check out our list of the 25 best free PC games to play in 2025, or for more options, the 25 best free games to play in 2025 on multiple platforms. Current free game at Epic Jotunslayer: Hordes of HelThis week, you can get Jotunslayer: Hordes of Hel for free, a roguelike horde-survivor game set in the dark realms of Norse Mythology. Similar to Vampire Survivors, you'll fight waves of enemies to earn divine blessings of ancient Norse Gods and grow your power. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Classic Final Fantasy Is Still Very Popular
description: Even after 30-plus years, the Final Fantasy games from the NES and SNES eras continue to stay in vogue. Square Enix has revealed that the Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster series has now surpassed 6 million copies sold. The official Final Fantasy account on X announced the sales milestone, thanking players for their support. The Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster series originally arrived in 2021, and at first, there was quite a bit of blowback for the font choices in the retro RPGs. The collection features remastered versions of the first six Final Fantasy games, starting with Final Fantasy on NES (1987) through Final Fantasy VI on SNES (1994). Updates for the titles include auto-battle functions and modernized UIs. The Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster series has sold over 6 million copies worldwide. Thank you for all your support, kupo! pic.twitter.com/1feTCfZrwj — FINAL FANTASY (@FinalFantasy) December 18, 2025 The Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster collection came to PS4 and Switch in 2023, followed by an Xbox Series X|S release in 2024. Overall, the Final Fantasy franchise has sold more than 200 million copies, as of March 2025. At that time, Square Enix noted that the Pixel Remaster series had hit 5 million copies sold, meaning the collection has sold another million units over the past nine months. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Blizzard's "Biggest Year Yet" Coming In 2026 For 35th Anniversary, President Says
description: Blizzard Entertainment president Johanna Faries has said fans of the Diablo and Warcraft company can look forward to what she hopes will be Blizzard's "biggest year yet" in 2026. 2026 marks the 35th anniversary of Blizzard, and Faries told Variety that the company has a "bold vision" for what's coming next. "The teams across Blizzard entirely, as an organization, are gearing up for what we hope to be the biggest year yet for Blizzard, and we take that statement very seriously," Faries said. "And it's all part of this new, bold vision for the future." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Arc Raiders Has Free Raider Tokens For You Right Now
description: If you logged in to Arc Raiders today, you might have noticed a special surprise. Developer Embark Studios is giving all players a gift of 1,000 Raider Tokens as a holiday treat. Players will see a "Happy Holidays" message in the game now, telling them they have a free gift of 1,000 Raider Tokens that they can use to buy whatever they want. "Thank you from the Arc Raiders team and Embark Studios for being a valued part of our community," reads a line from the message. "We'd like to wish you Happy Holidays, and hope you enjoy this small gift as a token of our appreciation!" 1,000 Raider Tokens works out to just under $10 USD. People can spend Raider Tokens on things like raider decks, bundles, and a variety of cosmetic items, including backpacks, charms, and emotes. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Baldur's Gate 3 Actor Sounds Off On Using AI For Voice Roles: "F**k AI In Performance"
description: Actor Neil Newbon, who voiced Astarion in Baldur's Gate 3, has shared his thoughts on artificial intelligence in gaming, and he didn't mince words. "Fuck AI in performance," Newbon told PCGamesN. He's talking about using artificial voice lines for games, like how Embark's The Finals and Arc Raiders do. For Arc Raiders, the studio hired human actors to record voice lines and then used AI systems to have their voices say lots of other things. Newbon pointed out that Arc Raiders has been a major commercial success, and he suggested that Embark bring back the actors to "redo the lines." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: World War Z's New DLC Adds The Walking Dead Characters To Another Zombie Apocalypse
description: Two of the biggest zombie franchises are teaming up as World War Z's next story campaign DLC will cross over with The Walking Dead. Players will be able to take control of four of the iconic characters from the show--Rick Grimes, Daryl Dixon, Negan, and Michonne--with The Walking Dead stars Andrew Lincoln and Norman Reedus reprising their roles as Rick and and Daryl, respectively. The first trailer for the crossover should look very familiar to fans of both franchises. The new episodic campaign will unfold over three stories that revisit locations from The Walking Dead, including Grady Memorial Hospital, the Prison, and the Alexandria Safe Zone. But don't count on facing The Walking Dead's infamously slow hordes of walkers. This DLC is pitting the characters against a new incarnation of World War Z's Zeke swarms. There's also a fresh take on a Zeke called Spiked Walkers. This zombie is impervious to melee attacks unless it's been knocked over. However, the window of opportunity to take it out is short, and once it's back on its feet, it's no longer vulnerable. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Technical Assessment: Bullish in the Intermediate-Term
When Is The Next Steam Sale? Dates For 2026 Spring Sale And More Fests Revealed
description: While it's always a good idea to save some cash toward the end of the month, Valve's quarterly Steam sales make it very tempting to dip into those rainy day funds. Fortunately, knowing when these sales will occur has gotten easier over time, as Valve no longer keeps people guessing about the dates. The company regularly posts the dates far in advance for its sales and promotional events, and for the upcoming Steam Winter Sale 2025, this will kick off on December 18 and runs through January 5, 2026. Beyond that, Valve has also dated several other events for the rest of the year, ranging from a fresh batch of demos being dropped in the February Next Fest to a spring sale starting in March. There'll also be promotions with specific focuses throughout the year, highlighting mystery, tower defense, and PvP games. Here's the full list of everything on the way. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: American Airlines starts flying the longest-range narrow-body Airbus plane. Here's what's inside
description: The first Airbus A321XLR for a U.S. airline took off Thursday from John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York, bound for Los Angeles.

title: Sony’s Fight Against A Horizon Lookalike Has Come To An End
description: Following its decision to sue Tencent for creating a "slavish clone" of its Horizon games, Light of Motiram, Sony has concluded its legal battle with the company. The game is no longer listed on Steam or the Epic Games Store, and the court case has been dismissed. That's according to new court documents filed earlier this week, and Tencent added that it has reached a "confidential settlement" with Sony Interactive Entertainment. "SIE and Tencent are pleased to have reached a confidential resolution and will have no further public comment on this matter," head of communications for Tencent Americas, Sean Durkin, said to The Verge. Announced last year, Light of Motiram was quickly compared to Sony's Horizon series as it featured a very similar art direction and tone to the post-apocalyptic sci-fi series developed by Guerrilla Games. Both games featured vibrant environments and animal-like robots, and Sony was quick to file a lawsuit. Sony and Tencent eventually began discussions to resolve the dispute, with Sony demanding that Tencent pause all public promotion or testing for Light of Motiram. Continue Reading at GameSpot
